parameters.description: Full pathname of the model document for which to create the drawing view (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ViewName
parameters.description: Name of the model view from which to create the drawing view (see Remarks )

parameters.description: z location of drawing view center in meters

title: IDrawingDoc.CreateDrawViewFromModelView3
description: Creates a drawing view on the current drawing sheet using the specified model view.
signature:
View CreateDrawViewFromModelView3( 
   System.String
ModelName
,
   System.String
ViewName
,
   System.Double
LocX
,
   System.Double
LocY
,
   System.Double
LocZ
)

parameters.name: ModelName
parameters.description: Full pathname of the model document for which to create the drawing view (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ViewName
parameters.description: Name of the model view from which to create the drawing view (see Remarks )

parameters.name: LocX
parameters.description: x location of drawing view center in meters

parameters.name: LocY
parameters.description: y location of drawing view center in meters

parameters.name: LocZ
parameters.description: z location of drawing view center in meters

returns: Pointer to the newly create IView object
remarks:
This method:
Places the center of the view at the specified location.
Uses the
swAutomaticScaling3ViewDrawings
setting to set the view scale. If this setting is set to True, then when a new drawing view is inserted, that view automatically scales to fit nicely on the drawing sheet. If there are no views on the sheet, the sheet scale is changed to the appropriate scale, and the view created uses the sheet scale.
If a model document  is currently open in SOLIDWORKS and you don't know its full pathname, call
IModelDoc2::GetPathName
to populate ModelName. Include the
.sldprt
or
.sldasm
extension in the pathname.
ViewName must exactly match the name of the model view. For example, the names of the standard views begin with an asterisk. This asterisk is part of the view name and must be included (for example, "*Front").
